page.title: 05Boughton House, Kettering.
page.content: Boughton House is situated 3 miles to the north-east of Kettering. There is a fine armoury, notable works of art, tapestries and a collection of 17th. and 18th. century English and French furniture. In Tudor times there was a monastic building on the site. Over a period of some 200 years this was enlarged stage by stage around seven courtyards. In 1695 the French style addition left the building looking much as it does at present and there has been little real change during the last 200 years. The design is based on Versailles and set into the honey-coloured stone walls are over 400 windows which overlook the parkland, gardens or lake. Boughton House creates an impressive view from the main A43 road.
